text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
AUDIENCE
Information Technology
Table of Contents
2.17.1.1 Program Scope and Objectives
Currency Policy for Software
) The IRS IT Commercial Off-The Shelf (COTS) software infrastructure shall use Software Product Versions, which are approved in the Enterprise and Standards Proﬁle (esp). (
) Purpose This section provides direction for maintaining IRS COTS software across the IRS IT Infrastructure. (
) Audience IRS IT employees and business units deploying COTS software the IRS IT infrastructure. (
) Policy Owner The Director, ES/EA owns the policies contained herein. (
) Program Owner Enterprise Infrastructure Currency is responsible for the ministration, procedures and updates to the program. (
) Primary Stakeholders All IRS IT ACIO areas and Business units that COTS software on the IRS IT infrastructure. (
) Program Goals These are the instructions for maintaining the currency of COTS software on the IRS IT infrastructure. (
) Terminology referenced in this IRM: • Compliance: A software product version’s adherence to the and guidance provided in the Enterprise Standards Proﬁle (ESP) Note: Please refer to IRM

for ESP related information. • Currency: A measurement of a software product’s lifecycle in relation the vendor’s latest major version. The latest major version is N, the mediately preceding major version is N-

) The COTS products on the IRS IT Infrastructure shall be considered in ance if they are using the most current “Major Version Approved” in the the immediately preceding major version that is approved in the ESP. (
) For product versions identiﬁed as non-compliant, product custodians will,

months of such identiﬁcation, provide a plan to become compliant via upgrade, replacement, or removal from the IRS environment, or request to remain on the current version via Risk Acceptance Form and Tool (RAFT). (

) Following a product version upgrade, any non-compliant instances of the uct shall be removed/deleted/deinstalled from the Enterprise or a request to retain the non-compliant version shall be documented via a Risk Form and Tool (RAFT). Completion of upgrades, removals, deletions or approval shall be completed within

months of the initial non-compliance date. The Infrastructure Executive Steering Committee (IESC) shall approve the disposition of all non-compliant versions. Note: This policy is not applicable in the test labs.
Currency Policy for Software 2.17.1
Compliance: A software product version’s adherence to the standards and guidance provided in the Enterprise Standards Proﬁle (ESP)
Note: This policy is not applicable in the test labs.
